intro: Euphorianthus pallidus, commonly known as the pale euphoriant, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its small, inconspicuous flowers that are often clustered in complex inflorescences called cyathia. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a glossy, waxy surface. The pale euphoriant is adapted to grow in moist, shaded environments, often found in the undergrowth of tropical rainforests.
